Fields.DialogueText: Helm, wake up! We're thirty degrees off course.
I am doing my best, Kapitan. The rudder is quite difficult to control for some reason.
If there's a problem with our ship, you need to report it.
It is hard to explain. Every time I steer us to... Chert!
Report!
Now it is going to the other direction. It feels as though we are spinning and turning at random.

Fields.MenuText: Is the rudder broken again? We just got that fixed.
Are we being pushed by the current?
Did Gromky give you some of her Mors? You can't steer the ship drunk!

Fields.DialogueText: I do not think it is broken, Kapitan. Something else must be happening.
Even a few knots of current would not make steering so difficult. Something else is at work, Kapitan.
Nyet, Kapitan! I have not been drinking, I swear it. Something else is wrong with the ship.
La-la-LAAA! And... turn and STEP and turn and STEP...
I think I just figured it out.
Kapitan? What is it?
Gromky is dancing with the ship again. Gromky!
Oh! I am coming, KAP-I-TAAAAN!
Ha, you startled me a bit. I was just working on my pirouettes. Whew!
First Comrade Gromky, Belle of this fine destroyer, please listen to me...
Da, da, da... You are going to tell me again how my dancing practice makes it difficult to steer the ship, I know this already.
Kapitan, why are you scowling at me like that? What did I say NOW?!
@BATTLE
Time to stop the spinning, Gromky. Morganas could show up at any--
To be perfectly honest with you, Kapitan, I am glad my last dancing practice was interrupted by that attack.
You mean the dancing practice where you were unwittingly spinning the ship to and fro, out of control?
Da, I think we are talking about the same one.
*Sigh*
I was relieved when those Morganas arrived.

Fields.MenuText: You wanted to pick a fight. Even I feel that way sometimes.
You were bored. The days at sea can get like that.
Your dancing was so bad, even I was glad they interrupted you.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet, that was not the reason why.
Nyet, that was not the reason why.
Chert! How unkind of you to say to me, Kapitan.
I was happy the Neizvestniy Flot arrived because... I would rather face angry Morganas instead of my angry kapitan.
Oh? I had good reason for it. I was upset because you were not paying attention.
When I dance, I sometimes lose a bit of control and the ship swings around with me, but--
But what? You know I need my First Comrade to be mindful of the ship. We're at war, Gromky, not the theater.
Can I go now?
I believe that I've made my point. If you want to be dismissed, go ahead.
NYET! I was asking if we could go to the THEATER!
*ALARM*
Incoming Morganas. Wonderful timing.
Prepare to EAT MY GUNS, Neizvestniy Flot scum! I have tickets to the theater, and you will NOT make me late!
We're not going to the theater, Gromky...
@BATTLE
Kapitan! KAP-I-TANNN!
Gromky, we've talked about this before.
Did you? Proshu proshcheniya. Sorry, Kapitan, but maybe I forgot.
You don't need to yell when I'm standing in the same room with you.
Was I yelling?
That reminds me, Kapitan! Ever since you mentioned it, I cannot stop thinking about going to the theater.
Going to the theater? I never said we were going. In fact, what I said was that we were not--
Perhaps I missed some of the important words, but the main idea is that we're going to see a show! The ballet, I hope! DA! Let's go!

Fields.MenuText: That actually sounds nice, but only when HQ lets us make a port call. That won't happen any time soon.
Maybe we can go see a nice little show... after we're done with the WAR.
We're. Not. Going. To. The. Theater.

Fields.DialogueText: But when will THAT be?!
UGH! The war!
Harrumph!
We have work to do. In fact, I still need to talk to you about--
Blin! So many obstacles to my dreams.
It is settled then. I must shoot the Neizvestniy Flot that much harder to bring about peace as fast as possible!
Only then will I see a ballet in the theater.
*ALARM*
Ha! Spasibo, Neizvestniy Flot! Hurry to me! Make my dreams come true PROMPTLY!
@BATTLE
Take a seat. We never did get to finish our last conversation.
I will have you know something, Kapitan. I was in the middle of practicing with my mine sling before you interrupted me.
Don't be grouchy, First Comrade. Listen to me.
Fine. What is so important?
Do you remember what we were talking about last time, Gromky?
It may have slipped my mind. What do you want to talk about?
Precisely that. Things slipping your mind.

Fields.MenuText: I think you are having trouble paying attention.
I think something is wrong with your hearing.
I'm your captain. Why don't you ever listen to me?

Fields.DialogueText: I wonder how far I could throw my mines if... wait. What were you saying?
WHAT?!
Da, you are my kapitan. Who else would you be? Ha! Honestly, Kapitan, what a strange thing to say.
You have a lot of trouble listening to me.
Are you saying that I don't listen? But of COURSE I do! Sometimes I...
What? Are you all right?
What was what?
I just asked if--
Oh! I just remembered something. When are we going to see a ballet at the theater?
Unbelievable.
*ALARM*
Gromky...
Not now, Kapitan. Listen! Didn't you hear that alarm? It means Morganas from the Neizvestniy Flot are approaching.
Honestly, Kapitan, you should keep an ear out for these things. Battle stations! Battle stations!
@BATTLE
I don't like this at all, Kapitan. I don't think a doctor is necessary!
The medical officer is here to help us, Gromky.
First Comrade, allow me to look in your ears for just a moment.
Do I need to speak UP?! YOUR ears don't seem to be working. I said NYET!
Don't be childish. Let the medical officer work.
NYET!
*RUMBLE*
Listen to that, if your ears can hear it!
Kapitan, it sounds like the hull is... shaking. Are we under attack?
No, Doctor. That's your patient getting anxious.
Can either of you hear me? Privet? Hello?!

Fields.MenuText: We can hear you, Gromky.
Please calm down, Gromky. I don't want you to hurt yourself.
Stop embarrassing yourself. The Gromky I know is stronger than this.

Fields.DialogueText: Then why aren't you listening to me?
And I don't want you to ignore me!
Ugh! You're right, Kapitan. But why are you doing this?
I just want to make sure there's nothing wrong with your hearing. Understood?
I understand, but why do you think something is wrong with my STEERING?
First Comrade, the captain said--
I know! I was joking! Go ahead and look in my ears. You won't find ANYTHING!
Gromky.
Da, Kapitan?
That wouldn't surprise me at all.
*ALARM*
Is that a hearing test? It certainly sounds a lot like the alarm.
@BATTLE
You are satisfied now, da? The doctor says my hearing is perfectly fine, Kapitan.
Don't take it personally. I had to make sure that wasn't the source of the problem.
I'm afraid to ask, but what problem are you talking about?
I noticed that you had trouble paying attention to what I say. If it's not your hearing, it must be something else.
Trouble paying attention?! What gives you cause to think I do not pay attention?

Fields.MenuText: You make the ship swerve off course whenever you get carried away with your dancing.
You keep shouting ''KAP-I-TANNN!'' at me when I'm standing right in front of you.
Don't think I haven't noticed you sometimes firing your mine sling without my order.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, this is true. I must practice my dancing, but I will try to keep it under control.
Oh. I just do that sometimes because I am excited to tell you something.
Blin! I must practice sometimes! I... I will try to remember to seek permission in the future.
I am passionate, Kapitan! I have grit, and I work hard to prove myself every day!
I know that you're tough, Gromky. Make sure you listen, too.
Did I hear you wrong, or did you want to share a nip of Mors with me?
Um...
If you don't, that's ok. *gulp* More in the flask for ME!
*ALARM*
UGH! ALWAYS when I'm trying to enjoy a drink!
@BATTLE
You can't avoid the topic forever, Kapitan!
I'd rather focus on the topic at hand. Your port turbine has a steam leak, and we need to get it patched up.
I will be fine. You worry too much, and you forget how lucky I am. I'm sure it will be fine.

Fields.MenuText: It's a captain's job to worry, First Comrade.
How can you ignore the damage? Doesn't it hurt?
Perhaps we have different definitions of "lucky."

Fields.DialogueText: Try not to let it show so much. You will get WRINKLES on that brow!
It stings, Kapitan, but I have endured worse.
Ha! My grouchy sister Gnevny would say the SAME thing to me!
Now, pozhaluysta, stop changing the subject! We MUST talk about the ballet!
It's either your excitement about ballet or that flask of Mors that has your face so flushed.
Both are thrilling to me, Kapitan! In fact, speaking of that, I--
*ALARM*
This interruption had better be for real!
I had nothing to do with it. Save that frustration for the Morganas, Gromky!
Neizvestniy Flot! You will PAY FOR INTERRUPTING MY CONVERSATION!
@BATTLE
Your face is flushed, Miss Gromky, and you can't stop smiling. Care to explain?
Ha! How about you try to guess what it is!
I don't think a professional First Comrade would refuse the order to--
GUESS!

Fields.MenuText: Your flask of Mors. From the size of the smile and the red cheeks, I'd say half of that flask.
The ship's been on a steady course, so it can't be your dance practice.
Don't make me guess. I'm your captain, and I'd appreciate the respect.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! That guess is WRONG!
HA!
I didn't mean any disrespect, Kapitan. I'm just so ENTHUSIASTIC!
I'll tell you what it is! I've been rehearsing for my new dance routine... and without disturbing the helmsman at ALL!
I must say, this new restraint is a nice change. I commend your professionalism.
Spasibo, Kapitan! I knew I could handle things better!
I AM THE QUEEN OF SELF-CONTROL!
Um...
Oops. I may have gotten a bit carried away there.
Damage report!
Nothing! Just, um, don't look at the rivets on the starboard boiler for a while. I...
Gromky!
Ignore the noises!
Oh, and I have somewhere urgent to be. Don't follow me to the engine room!
I won't fall for that one. And I may have to take back what I said about professionalism.
*ALARM*
AAAAAAAAAGH! Not now, you Neizvestniy Flot witches!
@BATTLE
I don't understand why you keep questioning me, Kapitan. The hydrophones are not broken!
They must be. Our sonar technicians haven't been able to track anything with it. We're effectively deaf.
Question them, instead! Perhaps they do not know how to operate their own gear.
We've had zero luck with that device since we left drydock, Miss Gromky. It was probably never fixed.
Chert! I swear it is NOT damaged! There must be another explanation.
Another explanation for why our sonar does not work?
Da! There must be one.

Fields.MenuText: It's busted. Check it again.
Maybe our technicians need more training.
Imagine that. Everything on this destroyer has trouble listening!

Fields.DialogueText: Chert! I wish you would believe me, Kapitan.
That is a possibility, Kapitan.
I can hear your frustration loud and clear, Kapitan. I am doing my best.
I will check the hydrophones... AGAIN... to verify they need no repairs. Then I will help the technicians.
I'm counting on you. Make sure we get that sonar working.
Aye aye, Kapitan. Your First Comrade will accomplish this task!
A Morgana surprise while we're deaf is not my idea of--
*ALARM*
Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Kapitan! KAP-I-TANNN! I am coming up out of the water now!
Thanks for the warning. Don't get me too wet.
How was your swim to investigate the hydrophones? Any luck down there?
Luck? Blin, I am not certain how to answer that.
If our hydrophones are not broken, is that good luck? Not broken is good, da?
Or is it good luck if they are broken, so we we'd know why we cannot track contacts with it?
Enough! Just tell me what you saw. Is it broken or not?
The hydrophone system is not damaged.

Fields.MenuText: Then it's settled. Our technicians need to learn how to use that equipment.
Maybe your shipbuilders gave us junk.
I have no idea. I just want it to work.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure that's the case.
That hurts my feelings, Kapitan.
Then consider this, Kapitan...
I talked to the technicians and watched them work. They have a theory I hadn't considered before.
What's that?
The faster we go, the more noise our propulsion puts into the water. Maybe it won't work at high speed.
That could put a big restriction on our capabilities, but it's better than nothing. How slow do we have to be to use it?
I'll work with the sonar operators to find out. It's still just a theory, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
First things first, First Comrade!
@BATTLE
That is the full report, Kapitan. I wish it were better news.
Three knots, Chief?
That appears to be the top speed at which the sonar hydrophones on this class of vessel are even remotely effective.
Going that slow makes chasing a submarine or Morganas quite difficult.
I am not sure what else to say, Captain.
Quite all right. In fact, say as little as possible. First Comrade Gromky is loud enough as it is. No need to wind her up even more.
I... Yes, Captain.
I see you, Kapitan!
Was that the Chief? Was that the report on the sonar testing?

Fields.MenuText: It was. Don't worry about it.
No! It was... a report about our ammunition reserves.
It was a classified report. We can't discuss it.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry about it?! I can't BELIEVE this, Kapitan! I've been waiting for those results!
HAHAHAHA! Nice try, Kapitan, but I can read you like a book! It was about the hydrophone results, wasn't it?
Classified?! But I'm the First Comrade! A Belle should have the confidence of her Kapitan!
Fine. Apparently the hydrophone only works if we're under 3 knots of speed.
Oh no. That's... slow. Chert! How do we track and chase a target at 3 knots? *sob* Why?! WHYYY?!
Relax, Gromky!
This is AWFUL!
That equipment hasn't worked since we left drydock. Why is she going to pieces about it now?
@BATTLE
Captain, the rudder. I am trying to stay on course, but we keep swerving back and forth...
Understood. Helm, do your best.
Do my best, aye, Captain. But how--
I know what the problem is. I'm going to talk to her right now.
Gromky is still upset about the sonar equipment.
And one, and two, and turn, and LEAP!
How's the dance rehearsal going?
AH! KAPITAN! You surprised me! I did not hear you coming!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't mean to scare you.
You must have been too carried away in your dancing!
Exactly. Your sonar can't hear anything either.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet! Nonsense. It is a pleasant surprise, and I am happy to see you, Kapitan.
I suppose I do get caught up in it, sometimes. Oh. That means...
Why are you so cruel to me, Kapitan? That hurts.
Your dancing was subconsciously affecting the rudder again. We were swerving off course.
Proshu proshcheniya, Kapitan. I try not to let that happen, but I was terribly distracted.
By the sonar problems?
I know it is a small thing, but it humiliates me!
It's just one piece of equipment.
Da, but it is also my reputation for being broken. It is why I hate being one of Gnevny's sisters sometimes.
I understand.
*ALARM*
HA! Another great way to blow off steam has arrived. I am all warmed up for you, MORGANAS!
@BATTLE
Yes.
That looks good... Hm. Perhaps that line is too long. I'll erase a bit.
Is this a bad time? Oh. You're drawing something. I didn't realize you were an artist.
An artist? Ha. This is just my sketchbook. I was designing costumes.
Mind if I look?
Not at all! I love talking about this stuff.
Hm. Hm. These costumes are...

Fields.MenuText: Quite fancy. I'm impressed at all of this detail.
A bit racy. That might not be a good idea for a performance on the ship...
Old fashioned, but in a good way. Classy, too.

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? I just KNEW you'd love them!
Oh! Well, it's part of the style.
That's what makes them so great!
Some people don't like burlesque shows, but I don't think those people know what they're missing!
Is that what you want to do? Make costumes for a burlesque show?
Nyet! My dream is not just costumes, but also to write the music, choreograph the dancing and star in a full vaudeville opera!
The crew would probably be entertained by something like that.
Wouldn't they? Imagine if my sisters and I, if all of us were all in the show with dancing and singing!
Even Gnevny?
Not her. Gnevny would not even be allowed to watch! HA!
*ALARM*
Put your book down. Time to go.
I am ready. Just thinking about Gnevny makes me want to SHOOT SOMETHING!
I'll have to remember that...
@BATTLE
Come back inside, Gromky! You may get soaked.
Nyet. I don't mind being outside, Kapitan.
I do actually review the navigator's weather forecasts, Gromky. There seems to be a storm near us. I hope we can avoid it.
Oh, really? How interesting. I was not aware of this. Hmm...
You're not fooling me. And the answer is no. We are going to avoid it.
Nyet? Pozhaluysta, Kapitan! Please reconsider! I WANT TO-

Fields.MenuText: The last time we drove through a storm, the damage was a nightmare.
Do you want to know what a ship full of seasick crew smells like?
Driving through a storm is fun, but it's just not wise.

Fields.DialogueText: That's one of the reasons I want to do it. To prove myself!
That's only half true! Only half of the crew got seasick last time.
Ha! Unwise? I think it's WISE to push our limits!
You heard me, Gromky. Get back inside. We're going around the storm.
We would have been fine... but it is your decision, Kapitan... Kapitan Stinky-Head.
Gromky, I am not happy with you right now.
Proshu proshcheniya, but you sound quite stressed! A drink will calm our nerves.
I have enough Mors in my flask for you to have three... *gulp* To have two... *gulp* To have a sip. Here you GO! TAKE IT!
One of these days, I just might have to...
*ALARM*
Too late! I'll finish yours for you. Let's start SHOOTING!
@BATTLE
Engines are at all stop, Captain.
Very well. Helm, mark our speed.
Drifting at four knots and slowing, Captain.
Very well. Report every half knot as we slow. Gromky?
Still too noisy... Chert! Kapitan, you know I don't like this.
We need to know how sensitive the hydrophones are. As soon as you can hear anything with our sonar, tell me.
Aye-aye, Kapitan. The ship's First Comrade will report this to you.

Fields.MenuText: Don't get embarrassed.
Is this too difficult for you to handle?
Quiet. You're supposed to be listening, not making noise.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't get embarrassed?! Kapitan, telling me not to be embarrassed is EMBARRASSING me!
Nyet. No problem. Now, let me concentrate.
Fine! Fine! I am trying.
Three point five knots, Kapitan.
Very well.
Three knots.
Anything, First Comrade?
I think I hear...
Two point five knots.
Da! I hear something! Bozhe moi! It is the strangest Neizvestniy Flot witches I have ever heard! They are...
They're what? Report, Gromky.
They're... whistling and squeaking at me. SQUEAKING?!
Shall we go to battle stations, Kapitan?
No. Gromky just found dolphins.
Hahaha!
STOP LAUGHING AT ME!
I did not mean to insult her. Should I apologize to the First Comrade, Captain?
When your shift is over, that might be a good idea.
@BATTLE
Kapitan! KAP-I-TANNN!
Here she comes...
I came running as soon as I heard!
I know. I heard you shouting all the way from the engine room to the bridge.
But... the important thing is that I DID hear it! Tell me what the new message from HQ says!
It's not good news. Several of our ships have recently been hit by surprise Morgana attacks.
How many Neizvestniy Flot hags? Which ones? What did they look like?
HQ has almost no intel on the attackers - just a long list of destroyers and cruisers that were heavily damaged.
Nevozmozhno. That is impossible.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe they were confused and accidentally shot at each other by mistake.
Not if their victims never saw them coming. Or going.
It's a hoax.

Fields.DialogueText: If any of those ships had Belles, that wouldn't happen, Kapitan.
They'd have to be exceptionally stealthy, Kapitan.
Would HQ really do that? There must be some truth to this, Kapitan.
Whatever's going on, HQ needs volunteers to hunt these Morganas. Volunteers who can hunt a stealthy foe.
Volunteer us immediately, Kapitan! Pozhaluysta! Please do it!
I already drafted a response to HQ. Are you sure?
Da! I am sure. I will drive this ship right into the office at Zurich myself if I must!
Let's just use the radio, if that works.
Of course it works! I think...
*ALARM*
Not now, Neizvestniy Flot! CHERT! Don't they know we are in the middle of something important here?!
@BATTLE
I know! I know! The reduction gear is grinding a bit and one of the torpedo tubes has a stuck hatch.
Hello to you, too.
I promise I will work on those repairs later.
You don't have to wait with the radio operators all the time.
When HQ sends a response to our volunteer request, I want to see it right away.
They still haven't given us an answer, then.
Nyet. Instead they just send more updates about the attacks. The Morganas strike unseen and then disappear.
One report says it could even be just one attacker. Can you believe that?

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like a submarine. Does the Neizvestniy Flot even have a submarine?
I think our allied ships are scared. These strange reports are proof of that.
I believe you need to get that torpedo tube fixed.

Fields.DialogueText: I will MAKE them into submarines when I blast so many holes in them that they SINK!
I'm scared, too. I am scared that HQ will refuse us for the mission.
I WILL, AFTER I HEAR FROM HQ!
What if HQ does not think I am capable of this mission to help my sisters?
Have some patience. Find something to do while we wait, Gromky.
Maybe I will go... work on that reduction gear for a bit.
Thanks, Gromky. If it makes any difference, I told HQ you were the best Belle for the job.
Oh! Spasibo, Kapitan. That means a great deal to me.
@BATTLE
You don't need to yell at me.
Proshu proshcheniya. I did not mean for my enthusiasm to disrespect you, Kapitan.
Hey! Up there! I can see your boots. Hand me that wrench on the table.
Here you go. Buttoning up the reduction gear casing?
Da, it is fixed as good as I can--
Kapitan, is that you? Give me a moment to crawl out from underneath here.
I wanted to bring this to you as soon as it came in.
The reply from HQ? For our mission? Tell me!
It's not our mission if they don't approve our request.
Oh.
But this is their approval message.
DA! DA! DA! Yes! I am so... schastlivyy!

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to make sure you are still up for this. We could refuse.
Try to stay focused. We don't want to disappoint HQ.
I know you'll do a great job.

Fields.DialogueText: I will send you to the ship's doctor if you keep saying such crazy things!
And I don't want to disappoint my sisters! That is even more important to me.
I will prove you right, Kapitan!
Keep your ears open. HQ says it might only be a few Morganas, but they're dangerous. And stealthy.
I am excited to get started! All ahead FLANK SPEED to the mission area...
Ah...
Da, of course. Right after I finish this reduction gear! ADEQUATE PREPARATION!
@BATTLE
Engines ahead, making bare steerageway. Two knots through the water, Kapitan.
Very well. Get ready to hit those engines if Morganas surprise us. Gromky?
I hear them! I HEAR them!
Calm down, Gromky, and report the contact.
I hear a... wait... Chert! I LOST IT!
If you can't report the contact without yelling, you won't be able to hear it.
This is so frustrating, Kapitan! What if one of these sounds is that Neizvestniy Flot assassin?

Fields.MenuText: I know you're doing your best. Keep trying.
It might be, so stay focused or we'll be the next victim.
Mouth shut. Ears open. Listen.

Fields.DialogueText: Forgive me. I am just... It is not easy.
That is what I am trying to avoid! Chert! Can I just sling mines everywhere and maybe we hit her?
I know. Go away. Spasibo.
What did you hear before you lost it?
I heard a humming sound. Maybe like whales, but maybe like machines? I heard it only for a moment.
Neizvestniy Flot contacts to starboard!
That wasn't sneaky at all. It must be a normal Morgana raid, not our special targets.
Then we drive them off NOW! I have important work to do!
@BATTLE
Request denied.
Gromky, report the status of the sonar search.
Any sign of--
QUIET! I am trying to LISTEN! THEY'RE HUNTING US, SO I MUST FIND THEM!

Fields.MenuText: Don't snap at your captain that way, First Comrade.
No need for you to be rude. Keep concentrating.
Shut your trap! Nobody can hear anything if you're yelling.

Fields.DialogueText: Proshu proshcheniya, Kapitan. I am trying very hard to listen, and would appreciate some quiet.
Da. Also, proshu proshcheniya for my outburst. I am anxious, and I need quiet to hear.
Oh! Proshu proshcheniya, Kapitan. I am just... trying very hard.
Do you remember what we talked about?
Da, yes. I don't remember right now, but whatever you said, I probably did it.
About paying attention?
Right, that. Pozhaluysta, let me just concentrate, Kapitan. Oh! I think I hear a--
*BOOM*
Where did that come from? Anybody see the Morganas that shot us?
Ow! That blast... like a punch in my stomach... Ooof...
Can you fight?
I just needed a second to catch my breath. All right. Now my mine sling is READY TO FIRE!
At will, Gromky!
@BATTLE
Whew. I... I have damage reports ready, Kapitan. I...
Just tell me if you're all right.
I have plenty of fight in me. Those Neizvestniy Flot backstabbers took their best shot, but we're still afloat.
Good. We drove them off, but I think they'll be back.
STILL AFLOAT! Do you HEAR ME?! HA-HA! Whew! That felt quite good.
Anything we can debrief? Any ideas about our strategy for the next fight?
Let's talk about something else for a bit. My head still hurts.

Fields.MenuText: How are your costume designs? The vaudeville ones, I mean.
We need to focus on the next fight. She's coming back, and we need to be ready.
Just catch your breath.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate that, Kapitan. *cough* I will enjoy talking about it with you after we defeat this monster.
You're right, Kapitan. *cough* I will try my best.
I will.
I wish I could remember more from the fight. She was upon me so suddenly.
Normally you can sense when a Morgana draws near. Were those different?
I'm not sure, but getting surprised is dangerous, Kapitan.
Chief?
Standing by, Kapitan.
Get more coffee to the lookouts and to the gunnery teams. I want us ready for the next fight.
Aye-aye, Kapitan. We won't get much warning before she strikes again.
Coffee? A nip of Mors suits me better! *glug* AH!
Don't overdo it. I need you alert, too, First Comrade.
@BATTLE
The waves are getting bigger, Kapitan. And more rain is coming down.
Steady as she goes.
Kapitan! KAP-I-TANNN! The navigator has wonderful news!
Did you hear the weather forecast update? This storm is bad, and it's getting much worse.
That does not sound like good news to me. I hate being seasick...
A heavy storm is a stroke of bad luck for us. With noise from the storm, we won't be able to track our assassins.
Nyet, Kapitan! This is GOOD luck for us!

Fields.MenuText: Any excuse to go galloping into a storm? This isn't the time.
Is your compass spinning? I think you're confused.
If you can find a bright side to this, I'm listening.

Fields.DialogueText: It is not for thrills, Kapitan. It is tactical.
My gyro is true, Kapitan. Listen to what I say.
Spasibo! Now listen.
A storm will deafen us to the Morgana assassins, but that's why they will hide in it.
Poor visibility, rough waves. It won't be easy for us or for them.
We will be on even footing. They cannot sneak up on us!
So... maybe nothing happens. Or we stumble upon each other and end up in a point-blank shootout.
Da. I LIKE THOSE ODDS!
Helm, steady as she goes. I want us to hide behind the rain as long as we can before the fight.
Aye-aye, Captain.
You sneaky witches, we are coming for YOU!
@BATTLE
That was a surprise, was it not, Kapitan?
Hard to say which hit us worse, the scare or the gunfire.
I know which one made me vomit my breakfast...
Helm, please don't talk about that. My own stomach hasn't decided yet.
Sorry.
A shame the storm cleared so fast, but it was fun while it lasted.

Fields.MenuText: My guts will be happy for calm seas again.
Give me calm seas any day.
Agreed. That storm was helping us tactically.

Fields.DialogueText: Suit yourself!
But it got us what we needed, Kapitan – a chance to surprise the enemy.
Then we'll have to find another way.
I'll have to try using the sonar again.
Helm, engines to three knots. Be ready to sprint when First Comrade Gromky detects something.
Aye, Captain. Three knots.
Try to keep it quiet, if you can.
That's something I never thought I'd hear you say, Gromky...
Wait!
Chert! I think I hear them! Get ready!
@BATTLE
My head is still ringing from that fight. I hope we gave better than we got.
I hope we did.
It's not too late, Gromky.
What? *cough* What are you saying, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: This doesn't have to be a suicide mission. We can withdraw if we need to.
Maybe we could ask HQ for reinforcements. This kind of enemy warrants it.
I have faith in you. Can you finish this fight?

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, Kapitan. We could, but we don't need to.
If we don't stop her, HQ won't have reinforcements. That's why we volunteered.
I have some dents and scratches, Kapitan, but I can do this. WE can do this!
Kapitan, it is just like the Ballet Russes at the theater. The show must go on!
Are you certain?
Ha! All I must do for strength is think of the face Gnevny will make when all of my sisters find out we won!
Then stay alert. They're not going to give us any warning.
Kapitan?
Yes?
A little quieter, pozhaluysta. I am listening for her with my sonar. They won't take us by surprise. Not if I can help it.
@BATTLE
My door is unlocked. Come in.
The show is starting in an hour! Are you coming?
I wouldn't miss your vaudeville show for the world, First Comrade Gromky.
On stage tonight, I will be Countess Ekaterina and will regale you with a variety of talent and entertainment!
And you found members of the crew to perform with you. You must be excited.
Excited to enjoy the show without Morgana assassins threatening my sisters.
One thing, before you go back to getting ready for the performance.
What's that, Kapitan?
I submitted a request to HQ. I put you up for a commendation.
A commendation? For what?

Fields.MenuText: For perseverance and courage in the face of danger.
For unfailing dedication to the protection of her comrades.
For actually tracking Morgana targets with such a terrible sonar system.

Fields.DialogueText: Did you really say that to HQ about me?
I am humbled! Did you really say such things about me to HQ?
I hope you made the words prettier than that!
Of course, I did.
Spasibo, Kapitan. I am grateful for it. Imagine, a destroyer with a decorated First Comrade!
You earned it, Gromky. You always found a way.
I had somebody like you to support me and help me improve myself. A true Kapitan.
And also, I think, somebody who is a true friend.
I feel the same way, Gromky.
Spasibo, Kapitan! Have a nip of Mors with me before I go?
Hand me that flask. Cheers!
*ALARM*
Za zdarovye, and now Morganas for the road! WOOHOO!
